bgu.csp.az.api
Class Agent

java.lang.Object
  bgu.csp.az.api.Agt0DSL
      bgu.csp.az.api.Agent
Direct Known Subclasses:
SimpleAgent
public abstract class Agent
extends Agt0DSL

Agent is the main building block for a CP algorithms, it includes the algorithms main logic. This is The base class of AbstractAgent and SimpleAgent. The agents now have only one entry point and one exit point â€“ means that there is no need for nasty System messages that was: a. make the algorithm code much more complicated b. imposes the use of a specially defined main because the algorithm can produce a solution / no-solution with lots of ways Entry point: the function start() (or init() in the abstract agent) Exit point: the exit point is not accessed directly instead you can call one of the following: by calling one of the finish functions or by calling panic

Nested Class Summary
 class Agent.AgentProblem
          this is a wrap on the given problem - each agent posess a wrap like this instaed of the actual problem
static class Agent.PlatformOperationsExtractor
          See documentation of PlatformOps.
 class Agent.PlatformOps
          this class contains all the "hidden but public" methods, because the user should extend the agent class all the "platform" operations can be called mistekanly by him, instead of making those operations private and then access them via reflection - what will create a decrease in the performance - we just hiding them in this inner class, one object of this class are held by each agent and its private, in order for the platform to obtain this instance it uses another inner class 'PlatformOperationsExtractor' this class contains a static method that extract the private field - because it also defined inside the agent it not have to use reflection to do so.

          collection of hooks that will get called before message processing on this agent.
protected  java.util.List<Hooks.BeforeMessageSentHook> beforeMessageSentHooks

static java.lang.String CC_PER_AGENT_STATISTIC
          the name of the statistic that collect the number of constraint checkes made by agent.
static java.lang.String MESSAGES_RECEIVED_PER_AGENT_STATISTIC
          the name of the statistics that collect number of messages that this agent received during work
static java.lang.String NCCC_STATISTIC
          the name of the statistic that collect the number of non concurrent constraing checks
static java.lang.String NCSC_STATISTIC
          the name of the statistic that collect the number of non concurrent steps of computation
static java.lang.String SYS_TERMINATION_MESSAGE
          the name for the system termination message the system termination message is getting sent only by the abstract agent and if we decide to drop it we should drop that constant too.
 
Constructor Summary
Agent()
          create a default agent - this agent will have id = -1 so you must reassign it
 
Method Summary
protected  void beforeMessageSending(SimpleMessage m)
          override this function in the case you want to make some action every time before sending a message this is a great place to write logs, attach timestamps to the message etc.
 void broadcast(java.lang.String msg, java.lang.Object... args)
          send the given message+arguments to all other agents excepts the sender (read the method send javadoc for more details about sending the message)
 double costOf(Assignment a)
          same as calling a.calcCost(getProblem()); accepts - if a is null return infinity
protected  Statistic createAgentStatistic(java.lang.String name)
          creates new agent statistic (or reuse an old one with the same name) agent static is a statistic that relevant to each agent seperatly for instance: "number of messages sent - per agent"
protected  Statistic createGlobalStatistic(java.lang.String name)
          creates new global statistic (or reuse an old one with the same name) a global statistic is a statistic relevant to current execution for instance: "total number of messages sent" you should avoid using global statistics as there much slower then the agent statistics most of the global statistics can be replaced with agent statistics and operation on the parent: "total number of messages sent" => "number of messages sent per agent" and the operation sum on all those statistics
protected  Message createMessage(java.lang.String name, java.lang.Object[] args)
          creates a message object from the given parameters and attach some metadata to it..
protected  void finish()
          stop execution of current agent - will not affect other agents most of the times the desired function to call is finish(current-assignment) or finish(full-assignment) this function is here so that you can implement your own shutdown mechanism
protected  void finish(Assignment ans)
          stop execution - returning the given assignment, will cause a TERMINATION message to be sent to all other agents, ans can be null and that will mean that there is no solution
protected  void finish(int currentAssignment)
          call this function when an agent is done and want to report its assignment upon finishing
protected  void finishWithAccumulationOfSubmitedPartialAssignments()
          will collect all the partial assignments that got submited (from all the agents) into an assignment 'a' and then will act as if you called to finish(a) :- see finish(Assignment) for more details.
protected  void finishWithNoSolution()
          stop the execution (send TERMINATION to all agents) without solution - this method should be used in csp problem as it make sense there, it is the same as calling finish(null)

 double getConstraintCost(int var1, int val1, int var2, int val2)
           
 Message getCurrentMessage()
          the agent is an message driven creature - each time the agent works it is because he received some message - this is the message that the agent currently processing = the last message taken from the mailbox

protected  void submitCurrentAssignment(int currentAssignment)
          should be used in algorithms that stop on idle detection - using this function the agent can submit its final result and when the idle detector will stop it this is the assignment that will be considered as the final assignment

Method Detail

createMessage

protected Message createMessage(java.lang.String name,
                                java.lang.Object[] args)
creates a message object from the given parameters and attach some metadata to it.. you can override this method to add some more metadata of your own each message that your agent sends or even modify the message being sent just use super.createMessage(...) to retrive a new message and then modify it as you please.

Parameters:
name -
args -
Returns:

getProblem

protected Problem getProblem()
Returns:
the problem currently working on each agents has its own unique instance of the problem (based on the global problem that was given to the simulator) and he managed it differently - so if you are building tools that have to be sent with the mailer to other agent dont include the agents problem in them as field.

getId

public int getId()
Returns:
the id of this agent in simple algorithms this ID is the variable that the agent "handling"

processNextMessage

                                    throws java.lang.InterruptedException
request the agent to process the next message (waiting if no such message in this agent mailbox)

Returns:
the processed message
Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException

public boolean hasPendingMessages()

protected void finish(Assignment ans)
stop execution - returning the given assignment, will cause a TERMINATION message to be sent to all other agents, ans can be null and that will mean that there is no solution

Parameters:

finishWithNoSolution

protected void finishWithNoSolution()
stop the execution (send TERMINATION to all agents) without solution - this method should be used in csp problem as it make sense there, it is the same as calling finish(null)

finishWithAccumulationOfSubmitedPartialAssignments

protected void finishWithAccumulationOfSubmitedPartialAssignments()
will collect all the partial assignments that got submited (from all the agents) into an assignment 'a' and then will act as if you called to finish(a) :- see finish(Assignment) for more details.

finish

protected void finish()
stop execution of current agent - will not affect other agents most of the times the desired function to call is finish(current-assignment) or finish(full-assignment) this function is here so that you can implement your own shutdown mechanism

protected void finish(int currentAssignment)
call this function when an agent is done and want to report its assignment upon finishing

Parameters:

submitCurrentAssignment

protected void submitCurrentAssignment(int currentAssignment)
should be used in algorithms that stop on idle detection - using this function the agent can submit its final result and when the idle detector will stop it this is the assignment that will be considered as the final assignment

Parameters:
currentAssignment - the assignment to submit

unSubmitCurrentAssignmenr

protected void unSubmitCurrentAssignmenr()
remove the submitted current assignment

getSubmitedCurrentAssignment

protected java.lang.Integer getSubmitedCurrentAssignment()
Returns:
the last submitted assignment will throw InvalideValueException if called before ever call submitCurrentAssignment

start

public abstract void start()
this function called once on each agent when the algorithm is started

isFirstAgent

public boolean isFirstAgent()
Returns:
true if this is the first agent current implementation only check if this agent id is 0 but later implementations can use variable arrenger that can change the first agent id

isLastAgent

public boolean isLastAgent()
Returns:
true if this is the last agent current implementation just checks if this agent id +1 is num_of_vars but later implementations can use variable arrenger that can change the last agent id

costOf

public double costOf(Assignment a)
same as calling a.calcCost(getProblem()); accepts - if a is null return infinity

getDomain

public ImmutableSet<java.lang.Integer> getDomain()
Returns:
this agents full domain - as immutable set - if you need to change your domain copy this set and then change your copy : HashSet currentDomain = new HashSet(getDomain());

getDomainSize

public int getDomainSize()
same as getDomain().size()

Returns:

isConstrained

public boolean isConstrained(int var1,
                             int var2)
Parameters:
var1 -
var2 -
Returns:
true if var1 is constrained with var2 which means : there is val1 in domainOf[var1] and val2 in domainOf[var2] where getConstraintCost(val1, var1, var2, val2) != 0

isFinished

public boolean isFinished()
Returns:
true if this agent call one of the finsh methods (or panic.. )
